parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Over, on the other side, beyond. Apparently accusative case of an obsolete derivative of peiro; through, i.e. Across.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Of Hebrew origin; my master, i.e Rabbi, as an official title of honor.
When, at what time. From the base of pou and te; interrogative adverb, at what time.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.
